item.title: Chapter 5
item.description: chapter 5 Auction A first-price auction A first-price auction the winner pays the price p he bids. highest wins and pays the price he bids Def a first-price sealed-bid auction with complete information $$ N={1,2,3…n}\ A_i=[0,] \u_i=v_i-p $$ v~i~ the player i attaches to the object v~1~>v~2~>v~3~>v~4~…

item.title: Chapter 6
item.description: chapter 6 Extensive game with perfect info Example 1: chain store game a chain store(CS) has a branch in a city, There is one potential competitor(C) in the city. the game proceeds a follows:C decide whether to enter the market,Given C’s choice, CS decides whether to accommodate or fight back. the profits are (0,0) (CS’s profit, C’s profit) if C enter and CS fights back, (2,2) is
